We would like to improve the way Mobile site sniffing works.

Ideally - if you go to a page on your mobile and it has a mobile equivalent, we will serve that.

If you go to a page on your mobile that doesn't have a mobile equivalent, you will go to the main homepage.

So for,

News, Blog, Picture, Olympic Sports, Paralympic Sports, Venues, About us, you will see the mobile version.

Can elabourate/provide a lookup table if required.

comments.value:
I know the Festival website isn't yet live .... but we need to think about the next step with the events database!

By the end of 2011 we will have a lot of additional events in the GDP database, and need to allow users to search the database and view results.

This means we need to build a front-end search and results tool within a page on london2012.com.

The key dates are:

1.       1 Dec  - web form goes live

2.       w/c 9 Jan - web search goes live

I'd be grateful for your thoughts re this, in particular:

1.       Do we need to commission search / results interface design from an agency?

2.       Feasibility of the timings above - it's basically 10 weeks but Christmas/New Year comes in the middle

3.       Feedback on how you have found the GDP web service - if you are happy with this as a viable solution for delivering the search and results

Can we catch up on this at some point this week?

Thanks!

Morag Reavley
Senior New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

comments.value:
From: Kavita Kapoor <Kavita.Kapoor@london2012.com>

We have a new project request. Potentially.

At each venue LOCOG will provide Games Mobility devices, you know
scooters and golf buggies etc.

We may wish to Create an online form via KitSite from approx Nov/Dec
to Apr/May. Information in the form would include; venue (drop down);
date (corresponding to venue); booking out and in times (based on
on-hours); vehicle type (3 in total but varies per venue therefore
these need to line up); name; contact number; email address; and other
comments (an open text box for questions/queries).

Ideally these requests would go direct to a mailbox e.g.
GamesMobility@london2012.com) and LOCOG will respond with a
confirmation or decline email (copy to be signed off by Kathryn) and
fed into SharePoint. However I think we can persuade this team to pick
up a spreadsheet instead like Young Games Makers.

Could I get a price for doing this bearing in mind that we have
alternative ways to service the request.

Kavita

subject: Online form with data export to sharepoint/spreadsheet

comments.value:
Russ asked "how do we know that the CMS is not communicating with the Map box? Should there not be some kind of monitoring or report to say that there are x requests that have been waiting y days to update"

We have a queue of map objects, we can create a process to check to see if we have any map objects sitting in a queue that are more than a day old and send an email if their are.

Should talk around a day to set something like this up, let us know if we should progress.

Jamie - think that this will be money well spent to do this going forwards.

Approved.

Russ
to include 0.1 days for #5217
As discussed with Danny - to be pushed to next month due to work load.

subject: Monitoring of CMS to Map connections
description:
Russ asked "how do we know that the CMS is not communicating with the Map box? Should there not be some kind of monitoring or report to say that there are x requests that have been waiting y days to update"

We have a queue of map objects, we can create a process to check to see if we have any map objects sitting in a queue that are more than a day old and send an email if their are.

Should talk around a day to set something like this up, let us know if we should progress.

Morag, i'm guessing a front-end issue from yesterday's js changes to search
- but this is now in the queue.

Thanks,
Wahome

Sorry Wahome, that's not what it is.
The GDP search api appears to somewhat randomly return either 15, 18 or 1 result!
I have a local script that reproduces it by making repeated calls to
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011
sometimes it returns 15 results, sometimes 18, and sometimes 1 result.
Interestingly, when it returns 1 result, that result is titleId=9000961547 which doesn't even exist in the feed from GDP (hence the frontend /saying/ 1 result, but displaying none).
Please can the following be forwarded to GDP?

===
The GDP search api appears to somewhat randomly return either 15, 18 or 1 result!
I have a local script that reproduces it by making repeated calls to
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011
sometimes it returns 15 results, sometimes 18, and sometimes 1 result.
Interestingly, when it returns 1 result, that result is titleId=9000961547 which doesn't even exist in the feed from GDP (hence the frontend /saying/ 1 result, but displaying none).
The test script I am running is the following which performs 20 requests, and write the responses to files named x1...x20:

#!/bin/bash
for i in {1..20}; do
  wget  -q -O x$i 'http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011'
  echo -n "x${i}. "
  perl -n -e '/totalevents="(.*?)"/; print "Len=$1\n";' x$i
done

Sample output as follows:
x1. Len=18
x2. Len=1
x3. Len=15
x4. Len=18
x5. Len=1
x6. Len=18
x7. Len=18
x8. Len=18
x9. Len=15
x10. Len=1
x11. Len=15
x12. Len=1
x13. Len=18
x14. Len=15
x15. Len=1
x16. Len=15
x17. Len=1
x18. Len=15
x19. Len=18
x20. Len=1

I think you're using EC2; I'm wondering whether there is one or more stale instance or an instance looking at old data (or something!).

Incidentally, I just tried again, and got sensible results (Len=18, 20 times) so I thought maybe someone had fixed it. However I've just tried again and got the above results.

===
Will flag this now with Zeeshan.

Thanks Kieran. Morag - this is definitely one to bring up in the GDP
meeting today.

>

comments.value:
We have a requirement to embed a web form as an iframe into a page on our website. Work in progress here: http://jupiter.ukdatapoint.com/wl-locog/controller.web?method=addVenueEvent

This is a web form which will allow members of the public to upload events to the Global Datapoint system, which we can review and ultimately publish via the events database. It will fit within the (coming soon) Local Leaders section of the website (in Get Involved), which will explain the campaign (getting members of the public to organise events to celebrate the Games).

We need the page with the iframe to go live on 1 December (hard deadline). We should have the final, London 2012-branded web form by 15 November, to give us time to test.

I'm hoping that's straightforward and that you have enough notice to do that. Please can you advise though on the dimensions we require for the iframe - it needs to fit within a normal content page with left-hand nav?

Thanks!

Morag

Hi there,

As we discussed with Danny last week  - following the patching of staging we are going to be patching the Web hosting production boxes today to upgrade RHEL 5.1 to RHEL 5.6.

This will begin with Web03 (also known as Web05) from 10.30 - taking it out of the load balancer and patching.

We will then need to be sure that the rsync from web01 to this box works.

If this works then we will be patching web02 and then web01 by similarly taking them out of the load balancer.

When we patch Web01 we will need to ensure that the stage03 to Web01 and web01 to web02-03 rsyncs work - we expect this to be later in the day- about 1800.

Trust that you will be on hand if there are any issues with this.

Russ

I'm afraid that I will *not* be on hand at 6pm this evening.

that it was going to take place out-of-hours. I'm wondering, if all goes
well with the 2 "slave" frontend servers (web02/03), perhaps the patching of

dedicated technical resource.

Kieran

This is happening quicker than we first thought - for example, web03 is already patched.

Russ

comments.value:
NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED Hi both, Hope you're well? Thanks once again for all your hard work and patience with the Learning Legacy website. Everyone here is delighted with it. There are now a few last things we need to do to complete the site before I leave the ODA (in December). I have outlined the final tasks below. Please can you take a look and send over a quote for this work? I think we will need a quick chat to go through all of this in detail so that I'm as clear as I can be on what we require - how about Monday? 1. Analytics - we are being harassed about measuring the number of people visiting the site, which is absolutely something we should have thought about before. What is the cost to build the capacity to measure the number of people visiting the home page? And also another cost for the home page and theme pages? This is quite urgent, so it would be great to get this set up ASAP. 2. Accessibility - there is an issue with the accessibility style sheets, as in they don't look great. AbilityNet picked up that the pages should 'render with a layout similar to the normal site, but with bigger text and more contrasting colours'. I know you've advised that doing that would mean effectively designing a new CSS layout/design purely for the accessible versions of each page - please can we get a quote for redesigning the accessible versions of the pages? 3. Flash plug-in - there is an issue with the London 2012 logo/scrolling pictures on the home page in Internet Explorer. I think this is something to do with 'flash plug-ins', as this was the error message that came up when we loaded the site in Firefox at the ICE. Please can you explore and rectify? 4. Alt text on scrolling pictures - we need the alt text to show as a yellow box when hovering over the images so that people know where they are. I think you have said this will require a component/function adding so may have cost implications. Can we get a quote for this please? 5. Archaeology navigation - in order to get the nesting right (to mirror the site map) we had to lose the top level menu when you click on 'The investigations' and 'The sites'. This is not ideal, as it simply doesn't look great. What options do we have to amend/fix this? 6. Full list of publications - The project team want us to add an option on each theme page for a full list of publications per theme (ie a list of all micro reports, case studies, champion products and research summaries for Sustainability). Can we add a link, or another box for this? Would be great to go through the options and costs for this. 7. External links page - we would like to add in External Links for each theme page. I reckon there will be around five external websites for us to link out to, per theme. Maybe this could sit under the 'related links' on the right? Also would be great to discuss options. 8. Technical Overviews - we are publishing some technical overviews of the project, which are external papers that we just need to link to. Because these are overviews of the project, and not theme-specific, are we able to add a tab at the top, which takes you to a page about the overviews? It just needs to be a page, with information about three organisations delivering the overviews. 9. Case study summaries - there are a number of case studies being published by external organisations next year that we have the summaries/abstracts for. We need these summaries to go on the website with links to the full case studies/publishers. I suggest that these go under the case studies section, or we have another 'box' for case study summaries. However, these aren't documents to upload (as with case studies), so there will be no thumbnail and no physical PDF to link to. It will just need to be a generic image, with the summary/abstract to go into the text box next to the thumbnail, and the link will take you to an external website (rather than a PDF). Hope this makes sense? The only other catch is that the links won't be available until next year! Best to talk through this one! 10. LOCOG testing of the website - Colin Miller has been continuing to test the website since we've gone live and has picked up a few 'aesthetic niggles'. I have asked him to outline what these are and will get back to you ASAP. They are not expected to be extensive and I'm hoping we can fix these in-house. Hope this all makes sense. As suggested, let's catch up early next week and then get a lump-sum for all of these changes. I want to ensure that we are very clear from the outset and that you are paid for all the extra work you are doing. Hope you have a lovely weekend. Speak next week. Indy Rihal Marketing Manager Communications Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6457 Blackberry: +44 (0) 776 055 4135 Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place Canary Wharf London E14 5LN Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com Information owned by ODA Please delete if you are not the intended recipient

comments.value:
Hi all, 

Just had a meeting with the Track Cycling team ahead of the test event's tickets on sale date next month. 

The changes to the Cycling London Prepares Series site have unfortunately come to us really late - would it be possible for you to schedule in these changes to be made the next fortnight.? ~Sorry, I know it's a late shout. 

The changes the Cycing team have requested are:

An adjustment to the banner at the top page (similar to that on the BMX text event page - http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/bmx/index.html). The alternative here is to remove the London Prepares Series logo top right and replace that with a UCI World Cup banner which will be exactly the same size as the existing LPS one. Would this be possible to do?

The second change is the logos on the footer. UCI anticipate that they will have 7 logos to pop across the bottom. Would it be possible to remove the blue and pink Preparies Series logo and spread the logos across the footer? 

If you could provide us with potential costs and timings to do these changes (if they are possible) that would be great. We require them within the next two weeks but as soon as possible would be even better. 

Thanks very much and apologies again for the late notice. 

Antonia

Marking as high. Will check with Tom re: other priorities, but this should be doable. 

Adjustment to banner: it is likely to be easier to give you a BMX-like banner than to replace the LPS logo, which in any case the only way to navigate back to the front of the site.

Removing the footer background image: shouldn't be a problem, I think.

Unless I have missed something, this is looks like 2-3 hours to code and test, although I wouldn't be surprised if there were a bit of toing and froing with the new images, so perhaps 0.5 days is a sensible estimate.

Could you get the banner and sponsor logos prepared, so that we can check that the proposed tweaks will work?

Thanks Danny. 

Do you have the dimensions of the BMX banner to hand at all please? We'll try and get something made up to that size ASAP, with approval from the cycling guys. 

Sponsor logos - I'll get these together for you too. 

Thanks

630x98px

http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/images/headlines/bmx-section-logo.gif

Hi Danny, 

Please see attached the approved 630x98 banner for the homepage of the Track Cycling test event. 

It's in PSD format - is that okay for you to work with? The Logos will be along shortly. 

Thank you

Antonia

Hi Danny, 

Track have confirmed the logos they would like to appear on the footer of the website as follows:

Samsung  (the one in the oval)
Tissot
Santini
Sky
Panasonic
UCI
UK Sport
British Cycling

Attached is the logos they sent over to me. Do you have the others that aren't in the folder to hand?

Thank you

Antonia

Hi Danny, 

Do you have a day in the next couple of weeks in which these amends are scheduled for? Just need to let the Track team know when they are likely to be in place for ticket on sale on the 17th. 

Thank you

Antonia

Antonia, this is marked a high priority for this week, but that effectively means not before this time next week. Please hassle me again on Monday and I will make sure it is done in the first half of next week.

Hi Danny, 

Hassling you as requested...I've had a couple of additional requests through from the test event teams for another coupld of logos to be added. This shouldn't increase the workload too much, but just to confirm our requirements are as follows:

A 630x98 banner to be added to the homepage of the Track Cycling test event. 
8 logos to be added to the bottom of the UCI track cycling test event website:
Samsung (the one in the oval) 
Tissot 
Santini 
Sky 
Panasonic 
UCI 
UK Sport 
British Cycling

**British Swimming logo to be added to the footer of the Swimming test event website (logo attached)
**Gymnova logo to be added to the footer of the Artistic Gymnastics test event website (logo attached)

I hope this is okay. Please let me know if you require any further info. 

Thanks

Antonia

Sorry Danny, one more thing...

The Test Event team have also requested that we change the LPS logo from TM to R where possible across the sites. 

I've attached a jpeg and eps file of the 'R' one for you. I think we only need to look at getting this on the main site, Track cycling, Artistic Gymnastics and Diving sites for now. 

**please note, the British Swimming logo needs to go on the Diving site, not swimming as I've incorrectly stated above... apologies!
Antonia, we are looking at this today.
Lars, over to you.

Hi Antonia, we have started on this, but there is one thing that it would be very helpful if you could get help with on your side. Is there anyone over there who could take the file "UCI logos for site footer.zip" that you sent us a couple of weeks ago and extract the relevant images for us appropriately sized and ready to upload? Many thanks.

Danny ~ please see my comments:

The banner for trackcycling is now in place, and also the TM is changed to an R but for all pages, is this ok?

Regarding the banners, it would be best to get a signed off preview/design for this so i can use the size and order of the
banners and implement them this way. 

Mr.L

Hi Danny, 

I've resized these up for you - hope they're suitable.

Please note, the order below has been requested as to how they should all appear from left to right with click throughs - if this is possible? I hope this is okay:

1. UCI (http://www.uci.ch/)
2. Tissot (http://www.tissot.ch/)
3. Santini (http://www.santinisms.it/)
4. UK Sport (http://www.uksport.gov.uk/)
5. Panasonic (http://www.panasonic.com/)
6. British Cycling (logo only)

NB - Sky and Samsung logos are not required on the footer as initially requested, it's just the six listed above now. 

Thank you

Antonia

subject: Track Cycling Test Event Website amends
description:
Hi all, 

Just had a meeting with the Track Cycling team ahead of the test event's tickets on sale date next month. 

The changes to the Cycling London Prepares Series site have unfortunately come to us really late - would it be possible for you to schedule in these changes to be made the next fortnight.? ~Sorry, I know it's a late shout. 

The changes the Cycing team have requested are:

An adjustment to the banner at the top page (similar to that on the BMX text event page - http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/bmx/index.html). The alternative here is to remove the London Prepares Series logo top right and replace that with a UCI World Cup banner which will be exactly the same size as the existing LPS one. Would this be possible to do?

The second change is the logos on the footer. UCI anticipate that they will have 7 logos to pop across the bottom. Would it be possible to remove the blue and pink Preparies Series logo and spread the logos across the footer? 

If you could provide us with potential costs and timings to do these changes (if they are possible) that would be great. We require them within the next two weeks but as soon as possible would be even better. 

Thanks very much and apologies again for the late notice. 

Antonia
